title: D. Count the Arrays
statement:
Your task is to calculate the number of arrays such that:

  • each array contains $$$n$$$ elements;
  • each element is an integer from $$$1$$$ to $$$m$$$;
  • for each array, there is exactly one pair of equal elements;
  • for each array $$$a$$$, there exists an index $$$i$$$ such that the array is strictly ascending before the $$$i$$$-th element and strictly descending after it (formally, it means that $$$a_j < a_{j + 1}$$$, if $$$j < i$$$, and $$$a_j > a_{j + 1}$$$, if $$$j \ge i$$$).
inputSpecification: The first line contains two integers $$$n$$$ and $$$m$$$ ($$$2 \le n \le m \le 2 \cdot 10^5$$$).
outputSpecification: Print one integer — the number of arrays that meet all of the aforementioned conditions, taken modulo $$$998244353$$$.
name: Count the Arrays
